column4: hello. i upgraded to 12.4 yesterday and my wifi doesnt work anymore. the little wifi icon on my keyboard doesnt light up anymore. network connections says wireless is unavailable. what do i do/
reask in #ubuntu+1
i read what you had to say. i didnt know about how the beta versions are for reporting errors. how do i know when a "real" version is out? what is it called then/
-devel will disappear
where does it say -devel?
check "lsb_release -a"
ok but when its "advertised" i guess it wont be called the beta version anymore, right? would you suggest to go back to two versions ago? 10.04 or what it was called? narwhal?
because that was a "Real" version? everything worked on it. all my plugins.
it's the development version right now, see "/msg ubottu final"
i see. interesting. so you suggest keeping to the official releases and not upgrading to beta versions?
don't use beta unless you feel like fighting/reporting bugs - that's it's only purpose
im not able to fight/report bugs so ill stick to the official ones
what model camera specifically?
i have the box, im looking
this might help? (untested) http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1701719
it says i need the device id number where can i find it?
1st just try installing gphoto2 and trying to connect.  http://gphoto.org/doc/manual/FAQ.html#FAQ-easyshare-dock
it didnt work. isnt there a way to just open the files from a folder or something?
have have no further suggestions - good luck.
ok thanks.
fix the flash funny...
you know, if i didnt have such "funny" comments, i probably wouldnt be asking for your help. probably because im rather clueless
